result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott B Kopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--pay costs of $443 ; due in $75 increments per month beginning 3/31/16 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--Per Standing Order $10 Drug Offender Surcharge is added

-serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment purposes; to commence on or before 3/14/16 by 7:00 pm 

--2 days credit for time already served given

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

--To submit a DNA Sample upon demand
Court continues bond until commencement of jail term

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott B Kopp

defendant.name: Kopp, Scott B
defendant.address: 221 College Ave Apt A, Watertown, WI 53094

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Clerks note - COC verified with Court reporter that the payment ordered by the Court is $75 per month beginning on 3/31/16 and on the last day of every month thereafter until paid in full. The minutes report due in 60 days and the payment plan. The 60 days is in error

Case called at 8:35 am [Clerk SH]  (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Scott B Kopp in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Humes files letter along with plea paperwork
Service of Amended Complaint Admitted; reading waived - Court approves amendment

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
ADA Beck submits victim impact statement

Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment purposes; to commence on or before 3/14/16 by 7:00 pm 
--2 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $443 within 60 days; due in $75 increments per month beginning 3/31/16 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--To submit a DNA Sample upon demand
Court continues bond until commencement of jail term
Recess: 9:01 am

Case called at 9:00am [mo]
Defendant Scott B Kopp in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Humes gives case update.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

recess: 9:03am

NEXT: Status Conference on 2/9/16 at 8:30am ((likely Plea/Sentencing))

Case called at 11:22 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Scott B Kopp in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Humes: State had requested follow-up investigation regarding a figure of alleged stolen items. That figure has just been received. Now need some follow-up discussions. Request additional DA PTC & STC, which will likely be resolution date.
ADA Beck: No objection
Atty Humes confirms waiver of time limits, upon questioning of the Court
Court reminds Mr. Kopp that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 11:25 am 

NEXT:  (1) Schedule DA PTC 12/23/15 at 8:40 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 1/7/16 at 9:00 am (possible plea/sentencing) - Send notices

Case called at 10:32am [mo]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Scott B Kopp in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Humes indicates that that she has been having ongoing discussions with the assigned prosecutor.
Atty. Humes requests an additional status 
recess10:34am

NEXT: Status Conference on 12/4/15 at 10:30am

[MK] case called at 1:32pm. 
Defendant Scott B Kopp appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Kopp verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 signature bond, with conditions:
--no presence at any recycling facility or business 
--no presence at Loeb Lorman, Lueck Metal Recycling, or B&J Welding 
--no contact with Ruth Mack, Ben Dricken, Lee Ann Manke
recess 1:35pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/7/15 at 10:00am   (2) Status Conference to be scheduled after the Pretrial date 10/30/ at 10:30am
